sect1.title: Included Topics
sect1.para: This section covers setup procedures of &susemgr; 3. You will perform the following procedures:

listitem.para: Initiate &susemgr; 3 setup from the command line
Create the admin user with the &susemgr; WebUI
Synchronize with &scc; to obtain a list of product channels available for your clients.

sect1.title: &susemgr; Setup

procedure.title: &susemgr; Setup
procedure.para: This section will guide you through &susemgr; setup procedures.

step.para: To begin login to the &sle; 12 desktop. Open a terminal and as root and type: yast2 susemanager_setup to initiate setup.
On the initial screen select Setup SUSE Manager from scratch and then select Next to continue.

Enter an email address which will receive notifications about the servers status. The number of emails sent from Manager can be extensive, therefore notifications via email may be disabled from the WebUI after setup if desired. Select Next to continue.

Enter your Certificate information and a password. The password should be stored in a secure location. Without this password it will not be possible to setup a &susemgr; Proxy Server. Select Next to proceed.
You will be using an Embedded Database for this guide. Enter a database user and password. This password should be stored in a secure location. Select Next to continue.

&susemgr; requires that you connect to &scc; for software, updates and patches. You will be unable to synchronize or provide channels to your clients without this information. Enter your &scc; Organization Credentials. You may register or login to access to your organization credentials. Select Next to continue.
Select Yes to run setup when prompted. When completed you will be presented with your new &susemgr; WebUI address. Select Finish to complete &susemgr; setup.

sect1.para: In the next section you will create the administrator's account and synchronize with &scc;.

sect1.title: Creating the Administrator's Account
sect1.para: This section will walk you through creating the administrator's account for your &susemgr; Server. This is the highest authority account within &susemgr; and therefore administrator account access information should be stored in a secure location. It is recommended that an administrator creates low level user accounts designated for administration of each organization or group under the administrator's account for security.

step.para: To begin open your browser and direct it to your &susemgr; Server URL which was provided to you after completing setup.

Enter your Desired Login*: name and Desired Password*:. Fill in the Account Information fields including an email for system notifications. Select Create Login to finish creating your administration account.

sect1.para: Congratulations! You should now be presented with the &susemgr; Front Page. The next section will help prepare the server for connecting your first client.

sect1.title: Synchronizing with &scc;
sect1.para: &scc; maintains a collection of repositories which contain packages, software and updates for all supported client systems. These repositories are organized into channels each of which provide software specific to a distribution, release and architecture. You must synchronize your &susemgr; Server with &scc; to add channels for your client systems. After synchronizing with &scc; your clients are able to receive updates or be organized into groups to be assigned to a specific software channel. This section covers synchronizing with &scc; from the WebUI and adding your first client channels.

step.para: From the &susemgr; WebUI front-page select the Admin tab.

From the Setup Wizard page select the &suse; Products tab. Wait a moment for the Available Products Below list to populate. You are present with a list of repositories provided from &scc;. Each of these repositories represents a single software source known as a Base Channel within &susemgr;. You can see the distribution, architecture and version from this page.
As you are adding a &sle; 12 client based on the x86_64 architecture, scroll down the page and select the check box for this channel now.

listitem.para: Add single channels to &susemgr; by selecting the + button to the right of each channel
Add multiple channels by selecting the check boxes to the left of the channels list and then schedule synchronization by clicking the + Add products button located at the bottom of the page.

sect1.para: After adding your first channel &susemgr; will schedule the channel to be copied and begin mirroring it. This can take a long time as &susemgr; must copy all software sources from the &suse; Vendor repositories located at &scc; to your servers local /var/spacewalk/ directory.

tip.title: PostgreSQL andTransparant Huge Pages
tip.para: In some environments, Transparent Huge Pages provided by the kernel may slow down PostgreSQL workloads significantly.
To disable transparant huge pages set the transparent_hugepage kernel parameter to never. This has to be changed in /etc/default/grub and added to the line GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT, for example:
To write the new configuration run grub2-mkconfig -o /boot/grub2/grub.cfg. To update the grub2 during boot run grub2-install /dev/sda.
